review: They have EVERY song I could ever think of. As soon as new music is released they have it available! You can search by album, artist, song! They have playlist made for certain genres, stations for different artist and genres, and you can even make your own playlist! I love that it‚Äôs connected to my Alexa at home too!
title: Perfect

review:
This app is great you can use it while your using other apps!
It has most songs I look for, the only problem is sometimes it won‚Äôt play when I have good internet or will randomly shut off other wise there are no problems with the app I would recommend getting it it is amazing!
title: AMAZING but some problems

review: Didn‚Äôt take long to start recommending playlists and songs I like... it‚Äôs very intuitive... which is a little scary if you think about it, but I‚Äôve already accepted that artificial intelligence is going to take over the world in my lifetime. Might as well go along with it and enjoy it if it means I get to keep listening to awesome music.
title: Best music app I‚Äôve tried

review: Love being able to see lyrics, and other songs, albums, from the same band. Still frustrated with why its difficult to go right to the album.  I have the unlimited music subscription. Unlimited music is unlimited, entire albums out on release date (paid music service). Worth it.
title: Using this forever

review: Enjoying the app immensely.  The explicit content control is very strict.  It would be nice to have something like the movie ratings PG13, R and such to allow songs with hell, a.., and b.... (in some case) through while restricting harsher words and content.  A lot of the times there are ‚Äúclean‚Äù/‚Äúradio edit‚Äù versions, but not always and can be difficult to find.
title: Awesome Variety

review:
Sound Quality is amazing. 5 stars.

But reliability to keep playing the music without needing to hover over the iPhone: 0 stars.

I had arranged some songs for funeral service. First song suddenly stopped in mid-song (about 3-4 min in) for no reason. Not even a pause to where I can unpause so the music can continue where it paused at. But a complete stop. No way to pick up exactly where it stopped at, but to either start from the beginning again or just skip to the next song.

So I skipped to the next song. It did the same thing: completely stopped about 2 minutes into the song. I went to the third song. Same thing 2-3 min in.

It never does this when I am actively hovering over on the phone monitoring the app. Only when I put my iPhone down and not want to touch it but enjoy the music.

Very unreliable.
title: Unreliable

review: The app on the phone works well but does not work well on the afire Stick. Every song skips once or twice. Doesn‚Äôt happen in the phone. Music selection is random at times and your history never seems to work right after a few days of not listening. The offline mode is great. I would give it more stars but the fact that Amazon‚Äôs own device skips and the history never works is beyond me.
title: Okay but could be better

review: This is a really great app but, it needs A LOT of bug fixes, there's stuff like when after you rename a playlist the keyboard won't go down (then you restart the app), there's crashes, the app reloads too often and it takes like 1-2 minutes just to load a song and other stuff. Even if you use this app casually, your bound to run into a bug sometime.
title: Really great but, needs some work‚Ä¶

review: Totally worth spending the extra for it every month. The music is literally the coolest tunes out there. Only issue I have is it doesn‚Äôt really work as well with Bluetooth and seems to use more data than other music programs. Meaning it takes really good signal to use unless you want to download the music to play offline.
title: Great app

review: I think it is really nice that I can download music for free (although I have Prime) unlike with pandora, where you have to pay to download or create playlists and basic stuff like that. So that‚Äôs what I really like about this app. But the fact that you have to pay more for unlimited is what I don‚Äôt like. It‚Äôs unfortunate when you want to listen to a song and you can‚Äôt when it‚Äôs unlimited.
title: Pretty good

review: I listen to music offline, and have quite a few songs downloaded on my phone on this app. When I tried to listen to music this morning, I saw the app updated and it gave a message I couldn‚Äôt use offline music until something downloaded. So, I hit download now. But I quickly figured out all of the songs from Prime music were no longer downloaded, and all the songs I had downloaded had to be downloaded again. This is ridiculous and I hope that this never happens again in the future.
title: Latest update undownloaded all of my songs

review: I need to save data, so I have turned on the options to stream and download on WiFi only. I‚Äôve downloaded all the songs in my playlist, but the app gives me a playback error and tells me to connect to WiFi for streaming. Not sure if anyone else is experiencing this, but it‚Äôs obviously inconvenient, especially when I‚Äôm unable to touch my phone (like while driving) and am stuck with no audio.
title: Won‚Äôt Play Some Downloaded Files

review: While not every song I want is part of Prime, plenty which I enjoy are available. Controls and design are good, easy for everyone and have shortcuts for those more familiar with phones. They‚Äôve updated the search capabilities, so apostrophes and such don‚Äôt screw up results. All songs one can access are also downloadable.
title: Exactly as advertised

review: Great app that can handle a lot of music (I have over 100,000 songs) the one problem is that the music license or album license can be taken away at a moments notice so one day you‚Äôll listen to your favorite song the next it‚Äôs not available. If there was a way to warn this that would be very appreciated but all in all well worth the money. Great features and an interesting offline reccomendation
title: Decent

review: Great music app but they constantly remove songs and re-add them under a different album. This wouldn‚Äôt matter except for the fact that the app won‚Äôt let you play the old version of the song unless you re-add it to your playlist from the new album. I am having to constantly remove unplayable versions of songs and re-add them and it is very irritating.
title: Great but not perfect

review: I love the selection of songs and how easy the app is to use. However, I really wish we had the option to purchase a multi-user subscription. I don‚Äôt like that only one person can stream at a time. My husband and I both like to listen and we have 4 kids that use it too. Sometimes there‚Äôs a battle of the kids stealing it back and forth from each other.
title: Great selection!

review:
Only problem is-
If someone searches up a certain song they wanna hear that song. Not every song with the same title. So I think the way to improve this is, if you click a song result (not in an album or playlist result obviously) that one song only should be added to the queue. Other than that it‚Äôs a stellar app and I prefer it to all other streaming platforms.
title: Great app

review: App has diverse library of music. For premium level access, paid subscription required, but ample selections w basic pkg. Love the Stations feature; provides good mix of artist in same genre. Can create playlists and download for offline listening. Sound quality is excellent. Overall, very good app; no glitches.

review: I love that I can get all the music I want and rarely can‚Äôt find something but the shuffle feature on ‚Äúmy music‚Äù plays the same handful of songs over and over and starts at the same place every time usually skips over a large portion of my other songs. title: Shuffle needs work

review: I have eclectic taste in music. So, it‚Äôs easy to find variety. However, when making an artist playlist, the same songs are often offered more than once. Also, I‚Äôm a Prime member & it‚Äôs annoying to have to pay extra for some of the music
title: Good variety of music

review:
Pick your song. Enjoy. What's not to like? Good features, playlists, album view, artist view, genre. Play in sequence or shuffled. 
Wish it had add-to-now-playing button. Voice activation would be super too. 
That's the great thing though. This music player is well supported, offers a big range of music selection. And plays all songs from your device and the cloud.

I used to own a Sansa and it would remember the last songs played every time you hit shuffle and make sure they were at the end of the playlist so you hear all your music before it runs out of songs...can we do something about that? And don‚Äôt play song 3,9,33,17,102... in the same order every time it resets. That‚Äôs just lazy programming.
title: Random feature

review:
But..
I had playlists set up for moods, fast/slow, genre & several under Comedy. When I return to say A comedy playlist, albums are gone, now ‚ÄúPremium!‚Äù & I end up having to redo almost entire playlists! It‚Äôs like, ‚ÄúThis guy listens to this artist or album a lot. Make it Premium & maybe we can get more $$ outta the guy! In my interest of comedy albums, little content to choose from & what is there often is hard to find. Don‚Äôt ever seem to just ‚Äòrun across‚Äô some as you do with say country or gag,pop music ca-ca!
title: I like this app...

review:
If you just take a small amount of time,you can create the perfect station for yourself.  Explore new music, create playlists, download to your phone or pad and listen w/o WiFi.

title: I love it!

review: I love this app, I use it at least once a day. But some songs are non on it. A blend setting.

Ps. Christmas is coming up...
lol

It‚Äôs automatic, it cuts out after a minute, and then have to restart the app just to play normally.

review: It‚Äôs been over two weeks and app plays songs and makes a horrible screeching noise in the middle and shoes it‚Äôs playing one song while playing another completely different one! title: App doesn‚Äôt work

Doing the most minor things, i.e. skipping a song or selecting a new one, causes it to crash.  Fortunately, it can be reopened & you can easily find your way back to where you were.
The first ‚Äúapps‚Äù used to be much heftier than today‚Äôs, & we had far less memory & zip processing speed, yet we didn‚Äôt have these constant crashes.  Makes me wonder what‚Äôs different.  What are these apps doing in the background that doesn‚Äôt have a thing to do with making it work for us?

review:
But I sure would live to be able to ‚Äú Shazam‚Äù songs I hear on the radio, in a store... and then immediately have the info., and then immediately add to my playlists.
Will this ever be possibly? Is it already, and I‚Äôve missed it? Is there another simple 1 tap solution? It‚Äôs frustrating to do this the long way; Shazam, remember, type in to Apple Music, then find, then add. Soon pleeeez?

Whenever I try my soundtrack I never get to the end of a song. It skips . Another song starts to play then after a few phrases it goes to another song. I use it while walking . It‚Äôs annoying to have to stop to put it on my own albums.

review: Love listening to different music (heavy metal, rock, country) and this allows me to do that without having to buy every song/album. It‚Äôs working out great. Just wish I had access to ALL the music but I guess they have to make their money somewhere (like Jeff doesn‚Äôt have enough money already). Still holding out paying MORE money for more music. I‚Äôve got some nice playlists going ‚ù§Ô∏èüéº üé∂

title: I love it

Not one complaint with Amazon's streaming music service. Maybe I'll search for heinous, obscure stuff from the mid 70's, and see how they do. I‚Äôm pretty sure they‚Äôre not judging my musical taste. 

 Update: okay, they might be judging my musical taste. I keep getting emails telling me to ‚ÄúStay up-to-date‚Äù. üôÑ Then we have a laugh, and I go back to listening to Leon Russell. And Elton John from 1971.

review: I would highly recommend this app because it is included within the prime membership, and you can stream on multiple devices. The only downside is that there is the prime music unlimited on certain songs, so you‚Äôre not getting all music under your prime membership

review:
Review pretty much says it all.  Even when the music is downloaded to your device, the lag between play and music can be substantial.  In addition, music disappears seemingly at random - things you listen to one day are no longer available for playback the next (due to licensing issues) with no indication as to what‚Äôs gone. 

The interface is clunky to use.  Making and editing playlists is a pain.  Edits to playlists often aren‚Äôt even saved.  

Bummer that the app is so bad, given the music selection is decent.
title: Clunky and slow, poor search results

review: Just go ahead and buy the monthly subscription it‚Äôs worth it. I guarantee you they have whatever music you want to listen to whenever you want to listen to it with no ads. There is no other music app I know of that has such a complete library of music. It really is the total package.

I will download a song to IPhone or iPad, assuming that I will not require an internet connection to play it.  Then when I wish to play it where I do not have an internet connection I am informed that I cannot play as no connection.   

Rules which likely I am not following correctly are very vague,,,likely I am in error somehow.   Very frustrating, so I seldom bother to use the app. 

Close but not quite as bad as internet radio apps,,but close in flakiness.
title: Flaky on what is downloaded to iPhone and what requires a WiFi or cellular connection.

review: Had prime for years never really used this feature now I can‚Äôt live without out it. üò¨ I prefer it to Apple Music because it streams more devices with ease. I can make it go very loud...

title: Easy to use but has major problem

review: It is nice to be able to use Alexa to ask to play a song and find about 85% of them that you don‚Äôt have to pay more money with a extra subscription monthly and not have commercials playing in between your songs and being interrupted by that
title: Once you get the hang of how to use it it is enjoyable

I really enjoy the app,
allisoncs19
title: Very nice

title: Decent app but annoying ads

review:
Positives
- free with Prime

Negatives

- feels like it 100% streams instead of getting the whole song first so it won't cut out
- seems like its trying to provide too much (lyrics, album art, etc) so just loading a track list takes longer
- wayyyyyy too many songs removed from albums or only not so popular albums available
- band singles shouldn't be in the album section
- if you pause and go to another app be prepared to reload when you come back
- this is picky: when I open the app, the song last played is there to start again. It would be nice to easily bring up the list it's playing from.

iPhone 11 Pro

I use this music app so much. It‚Äôs over quadruple the size of any other app on my phone with how much music is downloaded on it. But there are two issues with this app:

1) songs randomly grey out and aren‚Äôt playable anymore until you delete and re-add them. 

2) I hit the ‚Äúshuffle‚Äù button and within 1-2 songs it unshuffles itself and plays in alphabetical order.

The first problem is a minor nuisance, but the second problem is a constant bother. I can‚Äôt listen to a handful of random songs before it starts playing in alphabetical order and then stops the music altogether. I love the app, but these problems knock it down to a 3/5
title: Love and hate it at the same time

I have the unlimited version and I like it, but 2 things annoy me.

2) also, some of my music will randomly undownload by itself
title: Good but Small fixes could make it better

review: The service is amazing. However, it‚Äôs not a 5 star because it‚Äôs difficult to switch to a family plan. I would love to pay more and add devices. (Currently on individual) but it‚Äôs almost impossible because my billing is through iTunes. I can‚Äôt seem to cancel my individual service and add family without messing my account up.
title: Good could be great.

review:
Despite having a paid subscription I get annoying screens randomly popping up when opening the app trying to get me to upgrade even more. As a ‚Äúfree‚Äù (well, already pay for prime) user I get that happens, but begging for a 3rd revenue stream? Seriously?

Also, many artists pages are flat out broken. Try searching for the 80s band Madness and just try to find albums. Or how about ‚ÄúMan man‚Äù? Good luck with that.

‚Äî-
Edit: more nagging to rate 5 stars after already rating it. Seriously?

Edit: nag, nag, nag. But buy buy. Just let me use why I have paid for without pestering me!

Edit: Yup. Nagged again. Try searching for artists with overlapping names and see what you get. Guess what? You are still algorithm bait for 5 stars. If only there was better game in town... maybe there is and I am just slow and can escape this madness.

Nag, nag, nag.
title: Obnoxious up-sell screens, confuses artists

review:
The selection is great and the sound quality is fantastic if you have an HD subscription. However, there are some frustrating aspects to it:
- The UI never shows how long songs are which is a glaring omission.

- The queuing system stinks. You spend time queueing up a bunch of tracks and then accidentally click a track somewhere and your queue is wiped out

review: Love how easy it is to put together playlists and edit them. Also love the access to much (not all) of the not so common things I tend to favor. I don‚Äôt know why some of the things I choose become inexplicably inaccessible, though.

Nice feature w prime subscription and great that there are no commercials. However, the catalog is quite limited and anything recently released or mildly obscure is generally limited to the ‚Äúunlimited‚Äù premium service. In addition, the user interface is perplexing.

Finally, the size of the files is enormous. Anything saved locally takes up an unexpectedly large amount of storage on a phone.

title: What happened?
developerResponse: {'id': 9904699, 'body': 'So sorry for your trouble. We have an app update coming in the next day or two which should fix the issue (version 9.0.1). In order to keep your previously downloaded content, we recommend you not delete or uninstall the app right now. Check back in the Appstore in 1-2 days, search for Amazon Music, and you should see an "update" button. If you only see the "open" button, pull down on the page to refresh it, or check back in a few hours.  As for playing downloaded local content, once you update your app, you will see a screen to re-download your local content.  Once you do this, you can continue playing downloaded content.', 'modified': '2019-07-29T18:20:22Z'}

review: Apple Prime music is a great source from some of your favorite old songs and obscure titles. review:
Sometimes content moves to another album source and I have search for the songs and add them again. 

Changing out speakers can‚Äôt be done in the app at the time of this post. On an iPhone you have swipe up from the bottom. In the play widget find the circle in the top right. Click it and change speakers.
title: I like this app with a couple of cons.

review:
After the most recent update, ‚ÄúOffline Music Mode‚Äù is no longer ‚Äúno service‚Äù mode.

In areas where I have no phone service (which is common with my carrier), none of my downloaded music is available. That equates to thousands of songs (I am an Unlimited subscriber) that I downloaded specifically because I work in rural areas with no phone service (let alone WiFi).

It‚Äôs actually pretty weird when I think about it. Offline Mode DOES work in areas where I HAVE phone service, but has nothing to do with streaming data or WiFi. So clearly, now ‚Äúoffline‚Äù does not mean ‚Äúno service‚Äù. But it used to.

So if this remains a permanent change, I will cancel my subscription and try something else. When it works, I love the app and would give it at least 4 stars. But if it‚Äôs not going to work, then what‚Äôs the point?

title: Problems

review:
Cons:
1. Erratic shuffle with Ford Sync.
2. No way to increase the size of text within the app, so as to allow for easier reading of titles on an iPhone screen. 
3. Songs are grayed out of playlists and shown as unavailable even though I pay for Unlimited Prime Music but upon searching for them, they can still be found available to add to playlist (of course, now out of order).
4. No way to easily change order of playlists on the fly. 
5. No apparent way to save playlists. 
6. No apparent way to totally remove that damned Alexa button in app. 
7. No adjustable equalizer/treble-bass settings.
7-A. No handy preset equalizer settings. 
7-B. No way to easily change tone settings for different settings, such as adjusting them so as to sound better in the car vs. inside a helmet. 

Pros:
1. Less expensive than Apple Music.

title: Review

I hate the commercials on pandora, wish they had lyrics, wish they had unlimited skips, and don‚Äôt want to pay that much for their plus service. Enter prime music. Goodbye pandora. Haven‚Äôt missed it once. Merry Xmas me.

I clean a medical office on the weekends and I need my music!!!

review: At home, on my phone, through Alexa, in the car, this is the only music app I use now. Completely essential app to me now.  Couldn‚Äôt be without it.

When they wanted me to pay for a higher tier subscription to listen to a song I wanted, I immediately reactivated my other service. If I have to pay for more, I‚Äôll use the other sources.

review:
Definitely one of my most frequently used   apps.  It‚Äôs a great Prime member benefit. I actually prefer this free version to Apple Music, which I used to subscribe. 

Couple of suggestions for improvement:
- It‚Äôs really difficult to swipe up and enlarge the song currently playing  without pausing it or accidentally selecting something from the menu above. It‚Äôs really frustrating to require such fine motor skill.
- On my Windows tablet I can sort by lyrics. Would be great if this filter option was also available on the iOS version.

I find the app easy to use I love that you can make playlists. 
Here‚Äôs the but. 
After spending an hour or so creating a playlist I go back to it a month later and half the songs are no longer available. The songs might be available from a different album but my version is no longer playable. 
Now add to that I have about 200 playlists and CONSTANTLY songs are no longer available. 
This angers me.
title: Very good But

review:
Overall I enjoy this app now that I have spent about a year making playlists and adding songs. 
It would be great if it was streamlined so you could easily remove a song from a playlist w/out going through 5 or so steps (as a button from the page w/the lyrics while it‚Äôs playing). Actually the whole app could use some fresh eyes to simplify it as it is kind of convoluted. 
Would be great if there were music style 
/decade/ podcast/ radio stations by style and area...buttons so you could listen easily.
 The mix stations have a real small amount of songs so it ends up repeating really quick. Wish it was bottomless like Pandora.
Would also be great if it could play podcasts and radio stations.
title: Add radio stations would be nice

Overall it‚Äôs a good music app, but not worth buying prime for this alone. If you have prime get the video app too.

review:
This was not a problem on my gen 1 airpods, but the new ones will get messed up audio for a second when I do certain things with the phone. Once I stop touching the phone, the problem fixes itself after a few seconds and play proceeds normally. 

This does not happen for any other app, so I don't think it's a glitch in the pods. Fwiw, actions that alter the display are the most likely culprits. Locking and unlocking, rotating, etc.

review:
Two complaints:

First, the slow song starts. I have fast wireless internet and this is the only app that takes 15-25 sec to spin up a song selection. And it‚Äôs random ... one song will play instantly, another ... well, it‚Äôs like waiting for an original dialup connection. 

Second, the podcasts do not linearly sync in a series. If you start a series, where a story is covered on multiple podcasts, the ‚Äúnext‚Äù synchronism is not automatically played. Instead, it will play the previous one, replay the same one, or even stop.

It‚Äôs a decent selection of songs and podcasts; but the app itself could use some HMI improvement.

If you are looking for an exhaustive music library this isn‚Äôt it.

Update

In July, Prime music App changed. The offline mode takes up to a minute to play your song. I also noticed that after 1 hour of use, my battery was drained 50 percent. Someone changed the software to eat up your battery. 

The online mode is weak too. I have 7 favorite stations. There is no random playing of songs. Unlike other services, no matter what station I select, it starts with the same song, followed by the same song, followed by the same song..,,

Their software in the offline mode worked so much better in June. Now I can‚Äôt even use it. I am really disappointed.

review:
It‚Äôs like they took all the negative feedback from every other streaming music app, then based their app on that.

* Playlists? Sort of. You can‚Äôt set any kind of rule-based smart playlist (‚Äúhip hop that I‚Äôve rated 3 stars and haven‚Äôt heard in a month‚Äù). You can make lists of songs, but that‚Äôs it. 

* UI? Oh my, it‚Äôs bad. Dark grey on black, first of all ‚Äî is that supposed to be hip? It‚Äôs just illegible half the time. 

* Import playlists from Apple Music? Nope. They‚Äôll claim they can, but it doesn‚Äôt work.

I could go on, but it‚Äôs just super sad. If you have any other choice, pick it ‚Äî although most streaming music apps are roughly this bad, so... wait for the killer update in five years, I guess?

This app changes its UI on a constant basis.  The changes seem to be for the enjoyment of the developers because each new iteration seems to be worse than the last.

Why does shuffle always reset to on?  No clue. Any setting to default shuffle to off?  No. Can you turn shuffle off from the music playing screen once it‚Äôs on? No.  

So many of the UI Ux choices are so awkward. Like the developers got bored with a sensible layout and just kept tweeting random stuff. 

Frustrating.

pro
+ high res ( ultra HD and 3D)

+ has song lyrics 
+ speaker groups sounds great via app Bluetooth 

Cons

- iPhone/IPad or Car integration is just ok
- existing Playlist are below par
- shuffle play is very repetitive and not random
- weak algorithm to discover new songs
- outdated and limited play list 
- expensive HD family plan 
- no infos on artist or songs 
- offline playlist needs to be refreshed 2-3 times a week.
